programs.title: Explore our
programs.subtitle: Tan Tao University's School of Information Technology applies the educational philosophy of "Liberal Arts - Lifelong Learning" with curricula based on Duke University, USA programs.

features.title: Educational Model
features.description: Applies the educational philosophy of "Liberal Arts - Lifelong Learning" with curricula based on Duke University, USA programs.

features.title: Faculty Team
features.description: Most faculty members hold PhD degrees from prestigious universities domestically and internationally with strong research profiles.

features.title: Research
features.description: 100% of students participate in research projects and can intern in the industry.

about.title: About SIT
about.subtitle: Leading the Future of Information Technology Education
about.description: Tan Tao University's School of Information Technology is committed to training high-quality human resources in Information Technology and Computer Science, partnering with the 4.0 technology revolution.
about.liberalArtsDescription: Our educational philosophy is based on comprehensive and multi-dimensional knowledge in social sciences, humanities, and natural sciences before specializing in a specific field. This approach helps students develop self-learning ability, self-adaptation, and self-improvement in new environments.
about.lifelongLearningDescription: TTU graduates will be active learners and lifelong learners, aiming to enhance knowledge and professional skills to meet career requirements and improve themselves to work throughout their lives. They adapt to continuous learning to complete different tasks and build learning goals proactively.
about.qualityAssuranceDescription: We commit to training that meets output standards, teaching-learning methods and training management oriented towards approaching regional and world education. We enhance faculty capacity and implement teaching method improvements, evaluation oriented towards learner-centered approach.
about.technologyIntegrationDescription: We apply foreign languages and technology in teaching-learning and management towards learner, employer and social requirements. We provide high-level human resources with solid professional skills and progressive thinking.
about.transparentEnvironmentDescription: We build an open, transparent working environment, always creating opportunities for all faculty members to maximize their potential. We maintain a trustworthy educational environment with students at the center.
about.readyToStart: Let's build the bridges to a better future.
about.joinEcosystem: Join SIT's Educational Ecosystem. Get In Touch
about.historyText: The School of Information Technology, formerly the Faculty of Engineering, was established on January 4, 2012, under Decision No. 82/QD.TTU.12, to train Computer Science majors to meet society's human resource needs and expand Information Technology fields. The School of Information Technology became the official name from June 1, 2023, under Decision No. 70/QD-TTU.23.
about.facultyText: Our faculty team consists of full-time and part-time lecturers. All full-time faculty members hold PhD degrees from prestigious universities domestically and internationally (Australia, France, USA, etc.).
about.missionText: To train and develop high-quality human resources in Information Technology and Computer Science at the undergraduate level; conduct in-depth research and apply Computer Science, Information Technology, and Communications to various industries in society; pioneer in approaching regional and world university education standards based on the liberal arts education model and lifelong learning.
about.visionText: By 2030, Information Technology will be a high-quality human resource training institution that meets labor market requirements and be a top national unit in training, research, and technology transfer related to Information Technology and Computer Science fields serving the community. Training programs will be quality-accredited with extensive cooperation with domestic and international organizations.
about.valuesText: Maintain a trustworthy educational environment, good learning and teaching, with students at the center.

liberalArts.title: Liberal Arts
liberalArts.description: Liberal arts education philosophy is based on comprehensive and multi-dimensional knowledge in many fields of social sciences, humanities, and natural sciences before specializing in a specific field. Liberal arts subjects are researched, selected, and synthesized from different disciplines throughout the entire program, with the spirit of free thinking - free thought to freely choose, helping students develop self-learning ability, self-adaptation, and self-improvement in new environments.

lifelongLearning.title: Lifelong Learning
lifelongLearning.description: TTU graduates will be active learners and lifelong learners, aiming to enhance knowledge and professional skills to meet career requirements and improve themselves to work throughout their lives.

about.organizationText: The organizational structure of the School of Information Technology includes: (1) Faculty Council, (2) Faculty Leadership Board, (3) Office Department, (4) Professional Department.
about.qualityPolicyText: The School of Information Technology commits to: (1) Training that meets output standards, teaching-learning methods and training management oriented towards approaching regional and world education; (2) Enhancing faculty capacity, implementing teaching method improvements, evaluation oriented towards learner-centered approach; (3) Applying foreign languages and technology in teaching-learning and management towards learner, employer and social requirements; (4) Providing high-level human resources with solid professional skills, sense of responsibility to individuals, organizations and community, progressive thinking, effective independent or team communication and work; (5) Building an open, transparent working environment, always creating opportunities for all faculty members to maximize their potential.
